body:
@fmassa Good catch, I think I should change that. Quick question: that `int64_t` count is used as `nthreads` in [CUDA_KERNEL_LOOP](https://github.com/zou3519/pytorch/blob/2dfa26f1191121bcbc972385b032a3fd547ab822/torch/lib/THCUNN/SpatialGridSamplerBilinear.cu#L98). Unfortunately that macro [uses it as an int](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/0f65c9267d5ec55584b0ec65acb5374c95af9c16/torch/lib/THCUNN/common.h). 

Should I just change [`count`](https://github.com/zou3519/pytorch/blob/aea66d237087839026bfc4e84a08c6577551879f/torch/lib/THCUNN/generic/SpatialGridSamplerBilinear.cu#L87) back to an `int` for consistency?
